eventupdate
Class Database

java.lang.Object
  eventupdate.Database

public class Database
extends java.lang.Object

The Database class is used to establish a connection to a MySQL database. Select, update, and insert statements can be executed. Changes to the database are not finalized immediately and can be committed or rolledback.

Constructor Summary
Database(java.lang.String Host, java.lang.String User, java.lang.String Pass)
          Creates a connection to the MySQL server at the specified host.

          Creates a connection to the MySQL server.

Constructor Detail

Database

public Database(java.lang.String Host,
                java.lang.String Db,
                java.lang.String User,
                java.lang.String Pass)
         throws java.sql.SQLException
Creates a connection to the MySQL server.

Parameters:
Host - the address of the MySQL host database
Db - the name of the database to use
User - the username to be used in the connection
Pass - the password for the user
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur while connecting to the database.

Database

public Database(java.lang.String Host,
                java.lang.String User,
                java.lang.String Pass)
         throws java.sql.SQLException
Creates a connection to the MySQL server at the specified host. Used when specifying a database to use is not necessary.

Parameters:
Host - the address of the MySQL host database
User - the username to be used in the connection
Pass - the password for the user
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur while connecting to the MySQL server.
Method Detail

changeDatabase

public void changeDatabase(java.lang.String database)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
Changes the working database. Issues a MySQL USE database command.

Parameters:
database - the name of the database to use
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur while changing database.

printSelect

public java.lang.String printSelect(java.lang.String attributes,
                                    java.lang.String table,
                                    java.lang.String conditions)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Issues a select query to the database and return the results as a String. The select command is issued as a normal MySQL select: SELECT attributes FROM table WHERE conditions

Parameters:
attributes - the attributes to display from the table. Multiple attributes can be separated by commas.
table - the table to perform the select upon
conditions - the set of conditions that must be met. Follow MySQL syntax when passing multiple conditions.
Returns:
a String containing all of the rows that matched the select query. One row is printed per line and each attribute is separated by \t
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occurred during the select.

update

public int update(java.lang.String table,
                  java.lang.String attributes,
                  java.lang.String conditions)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
Performs an update to a MySQL table. The update command is issued as a normal MySQL update: UPDATE table SET attributes WHERE conditions

Parameters:
table - the table that will be updated
attributes - the attributes that will be changed in this table
conditions - the set of conditions that must be met for the update to occur.
Returns:
the number of rows that were updated
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur during the update.

insert

public int insert(java.lang.String table,
                  java.lang.String attributes,
                  java.lang.String values)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts a set of values into the database

Parameters:
table - the table which the data will be inserted into
attributes - the column names of the insert
values - the actual data to be inserted
Returns:
the number of rows that were inserted
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur during the insert.

select

public java.util.ArrayList select(java.lang.String attributes,
                                  java.lang.String table,
                                  java.lang.String conditions)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Issues a select query to the database and return the results as an ArrayList. The select command is issued as a normal MySQL select: SELECT attributes FROM table WHERE conditions

Parameters:
attributes - The attributes to display from the table. Multiple attributes can be separated by commas.
table - the name of the database table
conditions - The set of conditions that must be met. Follow MySQL syntax when passing multiple conditions.
Returns:
an ArrayList with each entry representing one row from the select query. Each entry in the ArrayList contains a HashMap with each attribute as the key and the result as the value. The values of the columns in each row can be referenced by HashMap.get("attribute")
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur during the select

commit

public void commit()
            throws java.sql.SQLException
Finalizes the changes that have been made to the database since the last commit.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur during the commit.

rollback

public void rollback()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
Undoes the changes that have been made since the last commit.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if any errors occur during the rollback.

getConnection

public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
Returns the Connection object associated with this database

Returns:
the Connection
